programme.title: Engineering the Future

programme.title: Engineering the Future
programme.desc: The power of the oceans' tides is the last great untapped energy source on Earth; from sub-sea kites to floating platforms, teams of engineers race to perfect the technology to harness the vast flows of water.

programme.desc: Parts of Miami Beach are under serious threat from sea level changes.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water supplies very, very seriously; in order to keep the taps on, Roman engineers constructed vast networks of aqueducts, tunnels, sewers, and drains.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: Clumsy gesticulation throws a sample onto a stove, accidentally inventing vulcanized rubber; grabbing the wrong resistor leads to the pacemaker.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: The failed experiment and the world's greatest crime-fighting tool; a clumsily dressed cut leads to the invention of plastics; how chance conversation and sausage poison changed the face of Hollywood.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Young Indian lawyer Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi is thrown off a train in South Africa for daring to sit in a first-class compartment in May 1893.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Lawrence of Arabia: For a Fistful of Sand
programme.desc: British officer T.E. Lawrence helps spearhead the Arab Revolt against the Ottoman Empire during World War I.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Cook: In Pursuit of the Southern Lands
programme.desc: In 1415, the Portuguese launch an era of explorations that lead to European discoveries around the globe and fierce competition between Britain and France for possession of North America and the West Indies.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Champollion: Unravelling the Mysteries of the Stone
programme.desc: French Gen. Napoleon Bonaparte's invasion of Egypt leads to 1799's chance discovery of the Rosetta Stone, which proves to be the key to deciphering ancient hieroglyphs, opening a window into Egyptian history.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering

programme.title: Elephants: Changing Lives
programme.desc: Few animals have more complex societies and interactions than elephants. For these slow-growing, long-lived animals, survival is totally dependent on knowledge passed down from family members.

programme.title: Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: In addition to rescue, Doug Thron is committed to conserving wild habitats for biodiversity.

programme.title: Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: After the Dixie Fire devastates the tiny CA town of Greenville, Doug heads in with his old friend Shannon Jay to rescue the lost cats that have been left behind in the burn zone.

programme.title: Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug takes his drone to the Dominican Republic after a call for help from a local rescuer.

programme.title: Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug travels to Malawi, in Central Africa, to work with hyena researchers.

programme.title: The Magic of the Wild
programme.sub-title: The Crown of North America -- Waterton Glacier Peace Park
programme.desc: On the border between the United States and Canada, a large project unites very different actors wanting to enlarge a national park in order to save it; vast parts of the almost 5,000-square kilometers of the protected area are untouched by humans.

programme.title: The Magic of the Wild
programme.sub-title: Splendor in the Yukon -- Kluane National Park
programme.desc: In 1972, the Kluane National Park is founded in the southwestern Yukon, an area with spectacular natural phenomena such as Mount Logan, Canada's highest mountain at 5,959 meters, and the world's largest nonpolar glacier field.

programme.desc: When the property for Bumpy's new club is being sold to a powerful, white real-estate developer, Bumpy must convince the black "Straw Man" to sell it to him instead; Mayme and Elise stage a protest at Margaret's school.

programme.title: Red River
programme.desc: A cattle baron (John Wayne) fights with his foster son (Montgomery Clift) on the first cattle drive up the Chisholm Trail.

programme.title: Mr. Holmes
programme.desc: Long-retired and near the end of his life, Sherlock Holmes (Ian McKellen) grapples with an unreliable memory and must rely on his housekeeper's son as he revisits the still-unsolved case that led to his retirement.

programme.title: Mr. Holmes
programme.desc: Long-retired and near the end of his life, Sherlock Holmes (Ian McKellen) grapples with an unreliable memory and must rely on his housekeeper's son as he revisits the still-unsolved case that led to his retirement.

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: Davy Crockett (John Wayne), Jim Bowie (Richard Widmark) and William Travis (Laurence Harvey) die defending the Texas fort against Mexican soldiers in 1836.

programme.title: The Black Stallion
programme.desc: Shipwrecked with a wild Arabian horse, a 1940s boy (Kelly Reno) bonds with the animal on a tiny desert island.

programme.title: At Close Range
programme.desc: A rural teen (Sean Penn) joins his father's (Christopher Walken) crime clan and winds up running for his life with his girlfriend (Mary Stuart Masterson).

programme.title: Eagle Eye
programme.desc: Two strangers (Shia LaBeouf, Michelle Monaghan) become pawns of a mysterious woman who threatens their friends and family and uses technology to control their actions.

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Master-of-disguises Simon Templar (Val Kilmer) falls for a U.S. scientist (Elisabeth Shue) whose cold-fusion formula he must steal.

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A scientist (Nicolas Cage) and a British spy (Sean Connery) who once escaped from Alcatraz are sent to the former island prison to stop a disgruntled war hero (Ed Harris) from obliterating San Francisco with chemical warheads.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: When the property for Bumpy's new club is being sold to a powerful, white real-estate developer, Bumpy must convince the black "Straw Man" to sell it to him instead; Mayme and Elise stage a protest at Margaret's school.

programme.title: Gladiator II
programme.desc: Lucius must enter the Colosseum after the powerful emperors of Rome conquer his home. With rage in his heart and the future of the empire at stake, he looks to the past to find the strength and honor needed to return the glory of Rome to its people.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) and his team take on their most impossible mission yet to eradicate the Syndicate -- a highly skilled, international organization dedicated to creating a new world order via a series of terrorist attacks.

programme.title: Fiddler on the Roof
programme.desc: A poor Jewish milkman (Topol) and his wife (Norma Crane) try to marry off their five daughters in czarist Russia.

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: An Irish-born boxer (John Wayne) returns to his homeland to reclaim his family's farm and begins a turbulent romance with a beautiful spitfire (Maureen O'Hara).

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: An Irish-born boxer (John Wayne) returns to his homeland to reclaim his family's farm and begins a turbulent romance with a beautiful spitfire (Maureen O'Hara).

programme.title: Hello, My Name Is Doris
programme.desc: With help from her best friend's (Tyne Daly) granddaughter (Isabella Acres), a smitten woman (Sally Field) concocts schemes to get the attention of a younger co-worker (Max Greenfield) in her office.

programme.title: Class
programme.desc: A preppie (Andrew McCarthy) acts like a Ph.D. candidate in a bar and picks up an older woman (Jacqueline Bisset), his roommate's (Rob Lowe) mother.

programme.title: A Bridge Too Far
programme.desc: An attempt to bring World War II to a rapid close nets disastrous results in this adaptation of Cornelius Ryan's book.

programme.title: Gladiator II
programme.desc: Lucius must enter the Colosseum after the powerful emperors of Rome conquer his home. With rage in his heart and the future of the empire at stake, he looks to the past to find the strength and honor needed to return the glory of Rome to its people.

programme.title: Pet Sematary: Bloodlines
programme.desc: In 1969, a young Jud Crandall dreams of leaving his hometown of Ludlow, Maine, behind but soon discovers sinister secrets buried within and is forced to confront a dark family history that will forever keep him connected to Ludlow.

programme.title: Here After
programme.desc: Claire is overjoyed when her daughter, Robin, is miraculously revived after a fatal accident. However, her relief soon turns to dread as she starts to suspect that something dark has followed Robin back from the brink of death.

programme.title: Paranormal Activity
programme.desc: A young couple (Katie Featherston, Micah Sloat) move into their first new home but are disturbed by what appears to be a supernatural presence that is most active at night.

programme.title: Paranormal Activity 2
programme.desc: After experiencing what they think are break-ins, a family realizes that the events unfolding before them are more sinister than they seem.

programme.title: Paranormal Activity 3
programme.desc: A videographer becomes obsessed with finding the source of disturbing late-night noises in his home and discovers its terrifying origin.

programme.title: Paranormal Activity 4
programme.desc: A teenager (Kathryn Newton) bears witness to terrifying events that occur when she and her family become the temporary caretakers of a creepy neighbor boy.

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension
programme.desc: An old and mysterious camcorder leads to the discovery of a supernatural terror in a family's new home.

programme.title: Happy Birthday!
programme.desc: When two friends embark on a journey to the seediest parts of Mexicali for a birthday celebration, they quickly realize their trip has taken a dangerous turn that involves sex, drugs, torture and a ransom involving the Mexican cartel.

programme.title: Foxy Brown
programme.desc: A nurse (Pam Grier) takes revenge on a drug ring for the slaying of her undercover-officer boyfriend.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: A young princess (Audrey Hepburn), tired of her constraints, runs off with a U.S. newsman (Gregory Peck) in Rome.

programme.title: Surrounded
programme.desc: In search of a gold mine, ex-soldier Mo Washington heads west. When an ambush forces her to take an outlaw captive, a battle ensues in the harsh wilderness.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: Desperate townspeople hire seven mercenaries (Denzel Washington, Chris Pratt, Ethan Hawke) to battle a greedy industrialist (Peter Sarsgaard) and his ruthless henchmen in the Old West.

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

programme.title: Gladiator II
programme.desc: Lucius must enter the Colosseum after the powerful emperors of Rome conquer his home. With rage in his heart and the future of the empire at stake, he looks to the past to find the strength and honor needed to return the glory of Rome to its people.

programme.title: Beautiful Girls
programme.desc: The opposite sex preoccupies working-class pals gathered for their high-school reunion in small-town Massachusetts.

programme.title: Wonder Boys
programme.desc: Terrified his second novel won't live up to the first and stumbling over his personal life, a writer (Michael Douglas) takes a gifted student (Tobey Maguire) under his wing.

programme.title: Snack Shack
programme.desc: Best friends AJ and Moose seize the opportunity to run the local pool's rundown snack shack. However, things take an unexpected turn when they meet Brooke, an effortlessly cool lifeguard who puts their big summer plans -- and friendship -- at risk.

programme.title: Everybody Wants Some!!
programme.desc: In 1980 Texas, a college freshman (Blake Jenner) meets his new baseball teammates (Will Brittain, Ryan Guzman), an unruly group of disco-dancing, skirt-chasing partyers.

programme.title: Licorice Pizza
programme.desc: Alana Kane and Gary Valentine grow up, run around and fall in love in California's San Fernando Valley in the 1970s.

programme.title: Wonder Boys
programme.desc: Terrified his second novel won't live up to the first and stumbling over his personal life, a writer (Michael Douglas) takes a gifted student (Tobey Maguire) under his wing.

programme.title: The Patsy
programme.desc: The people who lived off a late, great comedian pick a hotel bellhop (Jerry Lewis) to take his place.

programme.title: Serpico
programme.desc: Based on the true story of Frank Serpico, who sacrificed his career to expose widespread corruption in the NYPD.

programme.title: Serpico
programme.desc: Based on the true story of Frank Serpico, who sacrificed his career to expose widespread corruption in the NYPD.

programme.title: Bombshell
programme.desc: The provocative real story of three whip-smart, ambitious, strong women who anchored one of America's most powerful news networks -- becoming headlines themselves when they risked everything to stand up to the man who made them famous.

programme.title: Licorice Pizza
programme.desc: Alana Kane and Gary Valentine grow up, run around and fall in love in California's San Fernando Valley in the 1970s.

programme.title: Rollerball
programme.desc: A corporate dictator (John Houseman) tries to oust the star player (James Caan) of a brutal 21st-century spectator sport.

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: A police-state scapegoat (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must play a TV host's (Richard Dawson) deadly game show for the 21st-century masses.

programme.title: Contact
programme.desc: A scientist (Jodie Foster) seeks alien beings after receiving mysterious messages from deep space via radio telescope dishes.

programme.title: Transformers: Rise of the Beasts
programme.desc: Optimus Prime and the Autobots take on their biggest challenge yet. When a new threat capable of destroying the entire planet emerges, they must team up with a powerful faction of Transformers known as the Maximals to save Earth.

programme.title: Stargate
programme.desc: A portal takes an Egyptologist (James Spader), a colonel (Kurt Russell) and a team of soldiers to another planet with pyramids, slaves and an alien ruler.

programme.title: Rollerball
programme.desc: A corporate dictator (John Houseman) tries to oust the star player (James Caan) of a brutal 21st-century spectator sport.

programme.title: Into the Blue 2: The Reef
programme.desc: Two professional divers (Chris Carmack, Laura Vandervoort) fight for their lives when they encounter criminals in Hawaiian waters.

programme.title: Into the Blue 2: The Reef
programme.desc: Two professional divers (Chris Carmack, Laura Vandervoort) fight for their lives when they encounter criminals in Hawaiian waters.

programme.title: Where to Invade Next
programme.desc: Filmmaker Michael Moore visits various countries, including France, Italy, Germany, Finland and Slovenia, to examine how Europeans view work, education, health care, sex, equality, and other issues.

programme.title: Heaven Can Wait
programme.desc: Heavenly executive Mr. Jordan allows an angry quarterback (Warren Beatty), taken before his time, to return to Earth as a millionaire.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: A warden (Eddie Albert) forces an ex-football star (Burt Reynolds) to lead fellow inmates in a game against the guards.

programme.title: Raging Bull
programme.desc: The violent nature of prizefighter Jake LaMotta (Robert De Niro) leads first to a boxing championship, then to a downward spiral of self-destruction.

programme.title: The Boys in the Boat
programme.desc: During the height of the Great Depression, members of the rowing team at the University of Washington get thrust into the spotlight as they compete for gold at the 1936 Olympics in Berlin.

programme.title: Walking Tall
programme.desc: When Chris Vaughn returns to his hometown to find work, he finds that the lumber mill has closed and the town's big business is now a casino. Aided by his friend Ray Templeton, Vaughn tries to make a stand against the area's crime and corruption.

programme.title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners
programme.desc: Hoping to leave his dark past behind him, former assassin Finbar Murphy leads a quiet life in a coastal Irish town. However, when terrorists show up, he must soon choose between exposing his secret identity and defending his friends and neighbors.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A defense attorney hires an enigmatic ex-Army investigator to tackle the case of a highly trained sniper who apparently murdered five people at random.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher (Tom Cruise) goes on the lam to uncover the truth behind a major government conspiracy that involves the death of U.S. soldiers.

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: One man's brutal campaign for vengeance takes on national stakes after it's revealed he's a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organization known as Beekeepers.

programme.title: Assassin Club

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, he stays on to help and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.
